The Central Government introduced the Investor Education and Protection Fund (IEPF) to protect investors’ interests and promote awareness. It is established under Companies Act, 2013 (‘Act’) administered by the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) . 
 
 Companies transfer the amount in the unpaid dividend account to the IEPF when they remain unpaid/unclaimed for seven years from the transfer date. Companies also transfer all shares regarding which dividend has not been paid or claimed for seven consecutive years or more to the IEPF.
 
 It does not fall in the regulatory purview of SEBI.
 
 You may like to approach MCA or visit following web link to the website of IEPF of MCA for assistance related to your queries pertaining to IEPF and refund of your unclaimed dividend amount / shares:
 https://www.iepf.gov.in/content/iepf/global/master/Home/HelpAndFAQs/faqs-for-claimants.html
 http://iepf.gov.in >> Claim Refund (or) 
 http://iepf.gov.in/IEPFA/refund.html (direct web link for refund page on MCA / IEPF website)

The first step in the two-step process is to open a Demat account, followed by raising a request for the dematerialization of shares.
 1. Open a Demat Account
 • Step 1: Visit your preferred DP’s website and open a Demat and trading account quickly and effortlessly.
 • Step 2: Click on the 'Open a Demat and trading account' link on their website.
 • Step 3: Fill in the application form.
 • Step 4: Upload scanned copies of all the necessary documents for Know Your Customer (KYC).
 • Step 5: Sign the agreement with the DP along with the charges. This agreement contains the duties and responsibilities of both the depository participant and the account holder. Therefore, it is important to read them thoroughly before putting your signature.
 • Step 6: Once all the relevant documents are submitted, your application will be processed by the DP.
 • Step 7: On successful approval of your Demat and trading account application, you will receive a unique user ID and password to access your trading account along with a Demat account number.
 2. Raise a Request for Dematerialization of Shares
 Once you open a Demat account, you will have to put in a request to convert your physical share certificates into the dematerialized format. You can follow the steps mentioned below to raise a dematerialization request with your DP:
 • Step 1: Contact your DP for a Dematerialization Request Form (DRF).
 • Step 2: Fill up the DRF with all the required details and put your signature. Submit the duly filled form along with your physical share certificates to your DP. It is important to mention ‘Surrendered for Dematerialization’ on each physical share certificate.
 • Step 3: Your DP will process your request after receiving the DRF along with the surrendered physical share certificates.
 • Step 4: Further on, your DP would send the dematerialization request to the concerned company’s appointed Registrar and Share Transfer Agent (RTA).
 • Step 5: Once the dematerialization request is approved, your physical share certificates get destroyed, and your Demat account gets credited with the relevant number of shares.
 Further, you may also refer FAQs section available on SEBI website by accessing the following link https://www.sebi.gov.in/sebiweb/other/OtherAction.do?doFaq=yes. For your reference the link to FAQs on Depository Participants is given below – https://www.sebi.gov.in/sebi_data/faqfiles/sep-2022/1663591135406.pdf
 Investor Service Related FAQs - 
 https://www.sebi.gov.in/sebi_data/faqfiles/jan-2024/1704433843359.pdf

On death of a shareholder, shares held by the deceased shareholder can be transmitted to his / her registered nominee, and in case there is no nomination registered by the deceased shareholder, shares can be transmitted to the legal heir.
  
 SEBI vide circular dated 18-05-2022, has provided process for transmission. Please refer the below web link of SEBI circular:
  https://www.sebi.gov.in/legal/circulars/may-2022/simplification-of-procedure-and-standardization-of-formats-of-documents-for-transmission-of-securities-pursuant-to-amendments-to-the-securities-and-exchange-board-of-india-listing-obligations-and-dis-_59123.html
 
 Master Circular – 
 https://www.sebi.gov.in/legal/master-circulars/may-2023/master-circular-for-registrars-to-an-issue-and-share-transfer-agents_71271.html
 
 For queries related to transmission of shares, you may approach Registrar and Transfer Agent of the issuer company.

 NSE: www.nseindia.com>> Corporates >> Securities Information >> Changes in Company Names
 
 2). Companies delisted from BSE and NSE
 
 BSE: http://www.bseindia.com/corporates/Delist_Comp.aspx?expandable=1 (or)
 
 http://www.bseindia.com/>> Corporates >> Corporate and other info >> Delisted Companies
 
 http://www.nseindia.com/>> Corporates >>Securities Information >> List of companies delisted

Please note that in case the shares, if any, are not available for trading on a Stock Exchange, it is due to reasons such as de-listing / suspension. In this case, it will not be possible for investors to trade in these shares through the Stock Exchange. Trading can resume in shares when the company (de-listed) gets its shares listed at an operational Stock Exchange, and also when a suspended company makes itself compliant with the listing norms. Meanwhile, investors will be able to encash the value of such shares by finding willing buyer for the same.
 
 For assistance you may like to be guided by the advice of concerned company / it’s Registrar and Transfer Agent (RTA).

Investors must deal with the SEBI registered Investment advisor. Further, it is also advisable that investor undertake proper due diligence about the registration status, and must agree to fee structure, other benefits, terms and conditions, offered by investment advisor before deciding to become client.
  
 Details of SEBI Registered Investment Advisors are available on following web link to SEBI website:
  
 www.sebi.gov.in >> Intermediaries / Market Infrastructure Institutions >> Recognized Intermediaries
 
 The Do's and Dont's pertaining to investment advisor can be accessed at the below link:
